seisflows3.workflow.test

This is a SeisFlows3 Test class which is used to test out the underlying machinery before running an actual workflow. Contains simple functions used to make sure that all parts of the package are working as expected.

logger
property required(self)

A hard definition of paths and parameters required by this class, alongside their necessity for the class and their string explanations.

Return type

seisflows.config.SeisFlowsPathsParameters

Returns

Paths and parameters that define the given class

check(self, validate=True)

Checks parameters and paths. The validate function ensures that all required paths and parameters are accounted for, and that all optional paths and parameters are set to user-defined or default values.

Parameters

validate (bool) – set required paths and parameters into sys.modules

main(self, return_flow=False)

This controls the main testing workflow

test_function(self)

A simple function that can be called by system.run()

test_system(self)

This is an example test function which can take any number of args or kwargs. The base class is responsible for setting all of the necessary functions
